Unveil the Timeless Charm of Syria: A 7-Day Odyssey

Welcome to Syria, a nation where history's tapestry stretches across millennia and culture dances through the ages. Our 7-day tour is your key to unlocking this enchanting realm, where ancient wonders, warm hospitality, and vibrant traditions blend seamlessly into an extraordinary experience.

Why Choose This Adventure:

Damascus: A Living Legend
Your journey commences in Damascus, among the world's oldest inhabited cities. Explore Damascene houses, visit the revered Ananias Chapel, and savor local flavors at Nofara, Syria's oldest café. Dive into the vibrant food street, immersed in an authentic atmosphere.

Ancient Meets Modern
Discover the modern face of Damascus at the National Museum, home to the world's first alphabet. Marvel at the historic Hijaz railway station and witness architectural marvels like the Umayyad Mosque and Al-Hamidiyah Souq. Delight in local cuisine during lunch and continue your journey through ancient streets, caravanserais, and bustling markets. Conclude the day with a mesmerizing sunset from a rooftop vantage point.

Maaloula and St. Moses Monastery
Journey north to Maaloula, where houses are carved into the mountainside. Visit monasteries and ascend 300 steps to St. Moses Monastery, rewarded with panoramic vistas and access to a rich library. Your path leads to Homs, known for its Khalid ibn al-Walid Mosque and historic market. Finally, reach Aleppo, a city steeped in captivating history.

Aleppo's Timeless Allure
Explore Aleppo's history at the imposing Citadel and an 800-year-old soap factory. Immerse yourself in the lively atmosphere of the Aleppo Souks and admire rare artifacts at the Aleppo Museum. Journey through time to Syria's oldest operating hotel and the impressive churches of Jdaideh.

Apamea, Hama, and Krak des Chevaliers
Unearth historical gems at Apamea, featuring a stunning 2 km colonnaded street. Witness the iconic waterwheels of Hama before encountering the awe-inspiring Krak des Chevaliers, a remarkably preserved crusader castle in the Valley of the Christians. Enjoy the serenity of Mishtaya village and the vibrant culture of Marmarita, a nearby Christian village.

Palmyra: The Semi-Desert Pearl
Visit Palmyra, often called the "pearl of the semi-desert." Explore its iconic ruins, including the Temple of Bel and the Arch of Triumph. Gain insight into Palmyra's history, from its rise in the 1st century AD to its enduring spirit. Experience a scenic drive and traditional Bedouin hospitality for lunch.

Departure with Lasting Memories
On your final day, take time to explore Damascus or indulge in local shopping. Savor the flavors of Syrian cuisine once more before bidding adieu. Your departure will be seamless, with transportation to Damascus International Airport, Beirut, or Jordan. As you leave, cast one last gaze upon Damascus, carrying cherished memories of an unforgettable journey.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Damascus | Begin your extraordinary journey by arriving in Damascus, either through Beirut, Jordan, or Damascus airport. Your friendly guide will warmly welcome you and accompany you to your hotel. After a smooth check-in process, take a short break to relax before embarking on a captivating walking tour of the ancient city. Immerse yourself in the rich history as you explore the Christian and Jewish quarters, visit the revered Ananias Chapel, and admire the exquisite Damascene houses. Indulge in the lively atmosphere of the food street and make a stop at Nofara, Syria's oldest functioning café, to savor its authentic charm.

Damascus Walk | Awaken to a delightful breakfast before venturing into the modern side of Damascus. Begin your day at the National Museum, housing rare artifacts that include the world's first alphabet. En route to the ancient city, marvel at captivating attractions such as the century-old Hijaz railway station. Discover the architectural wonders of the iconic Umayyad Mosque and immerse yourself in the vibrant Al-Hamidiyah Souq. Take a break to savor local cuisine during lunchtime. In the afternoon, continue your exploration of ancient houses, caravanserais, and bustling souks. Conclude the day by ascending to a rooftop vantage point, where you can witness a breathtaking sunset over the city.

Maaloula – St. Moses Monastery – Homs - Aleppo | Embark on a northbound journey from Damascus, making your first stop in the ancient city of Maaloula, known for its houses intricately carved into the mountainside. Explore the city's rich history by visiting two monasteries and witnessing the Safir Hotel, once used as a headquarters by Nusra Front. Next, venture to St. Moses Monastery, accessible after ascending approximately 300 steps. The reward for your effort is breathtaking scenery and access to an extensive library. Continue your journey to Homs, Syria's third-largest city and a prominent hub for oil and gas production. Visit the historic Khalid ibn al-Walid Mosque and immerse yourself in the picturesque old market. Conclude the day by reaching Aleppo, where you will spend two nights, surrounded by its captivating charm.

Aleppo Walk | Embark on a captivating exploration of Aleppo, starting with a visit to the imposing Citadel. Wander through the enchanting alleys of the ancient city and witness the fascinating craftsmanship of an 800-year-old soap factory. Immerse yourself in the vibrant atmosphere of the Aleppo Souks and admire rare artifacts at the Aleppo Museum. As you continue your journey, marvel at Syria's oldest functioning hotel and discover the impressive churches of the 14th-century neighborhood of Jdaideh.

Apamea – Hama – Krak des Chevaliers | Set off on a day filled with historical wonders, beginning at the mesmerizing Greek-Roman site of Apamea, featuring a magnificent 2 km colonnaded street. Continue your journey to Hama, known as the city of waterwheels, where you can marvel at these famous landmarks up close. Then, venture to the awe-inspiring Krak des Chevaliers, a remarkably well-preserved crusader castle nestled in the picturesque Valley of the Christians. Conclude the day's adventures with a retreat to the tranquil village of Mishtaya, where you can enjoy the vibrant atmosphere of the nearby Christian village of Marmarita during your overnight stay.

Palmyra – Damascus | Embark on a memorable visit to Palmyra, often referred to as the pearl of the semi-desert. Explore the ancient ruins, including the iconic Temple of Bel and the majestic Arch of Triumph, testaments to the city's past as a vital trade hub. Gain insight into Palmyra's history, from its rise in the 1st century AD to the tragic destruction it endured in 2015. Enjoy a scenic drive lasting approximately three hours, and after the tour, pause at a traditional Bedouin tent for a rejuvenating break and a delightful lunch. Return to Damascus for an overnight stay, reflecting on the enchanting memories made during your journey.

Departure | As your remarkable adventure draws to a close, take advantage of some free time on your final day to explore Damascus or engage in last-minute shopping. Don't miss the opportunity to indulge in the delicious local cuisine one last time before you bid farewell to Syria. Your driver will pick you up from your hotel and transport you to Damascus International Airport, Beirut, or Jordan, ensuring a seamless departure. As you depart, cast a final gaze upon the beautiful city of Damascus, cherishing the unforgettable experiences and cherished memories you have forged throughout your time in Syria.

generalInfo:
Explore the Enchanting Wonders of Syria: A 10-Day Panoramic Journey

Nestled in the heart of the Middle East, Syria beckons travelers with a timeless allure that transcends millennia. Embark on a captivating 10-day tour that promises an immersive journey into the cradle of civilization, where ancient history, rich culture, and architectural marvels blend seamlessly to create an unforgettable experience. This tour is not just an adventure; it's a revelation of the soul of Syria.

Reasons to Visit Syria

1. Unparalleled Historical Significance:

Syria boasts a history that stretches back thousands of years, and on this tour, you'll have the opportunity to explore its most iconic landmarks. From the ancient streets of Damascus, one of the world's oldest continuously inhabited cities, to the majestic ruins of Palmyra, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, history buffs will be in awe. You can trace the footsteps of emperors, scholars, and conquerors who left their indelible mark on this land.

2. UNESCO World Heritage Sites:

Syria is home to six UNESCO World Heritage Sites, and this tour covers them all. The awe-inspiring ruins of Palmyra, the iconic Krak Des Chevaliers, the ancient city of Bosra, the archaeological site of Ugarit, and more await your exploration. These sites offer not only a glimpse into the past but also an appreciation of the architectural and cultural heritage of Syria.

3. Diverse Cultural Encounters:

Syria's diverse cultural tapestry is a testament to its historical significance as a crossroads of civilizations. As you wander through the historic streets of Aleppo, you'll encounter the influences of Arab, Ottoman, and French cultures. This tour offers the chance to interact with locals, taste traditional cuisine, and witness age-old customs, providing a deep understanding of Syrian culture.

4. Architectural Marvels:

From the grand Umayyad Mosque in Damascus, a masterpiece of Islamic architecture, to the imposing Krak Des Chevaliers, one of the most impressive castles in the world, Syria's architectural wonders will leave you in awe. Marvel at the intricate designs, towering minarets, and well-preserved fortifications that dot the landscape.

5. Enigmatic Mysteries:

Syria holds its share of enigmatic mysteries, such as the ancient city of Ebla, which was only rediscovered in the late 20th century, shedding light on a forgotten chapter of history. Explore the intriguing remnants of past civilizations, and let the mysteries of Syria captivate your imagination.

6. Local Hospitality:

Experience the warmth and hospitality of the Syrian people as you visit bustling bazaars, sip traditional tea in vibrant markets, and share stories with locals. It's an opportunity to forge meaningful connections and gain insights into daily life in Syria.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Damascus | Begin your journey to Syria with a comfortable pick-up service from Beirut, Jordan, or Damascus airport. Our friendly driver will take you on a scenic drive, including a border crossing, lasting 3 to 4 hours. After arriving in Damascus, check-in to your hotel and take a short break before embarking on a fascinating walking tour of the ancient city. Explore the Christian and Jewish quarters, visit the historic Ananias Chapel where St. Paul began his journey, and discover hidden Damascene houses. Experience the lively food street in the evening and visit Nofara, the oldest functioning café in Syria, to witness storytellers entertaining their audiences. Experience the magic of Damascus’ nightlife with a variety of entertainment options. Enjoy concerts, bars, traditional cafes, and even a traditional bath for a rejuvenating experience. Damascus is completely safe to explore at night, and your hotel is conveniently located near excellent restaurants serving delicious local cuisine.

Exploring Damascus | Begin your day with breakfast before exploring the city. Start with the modern side at the National Museum, home to rare artifacts, including the first alphabet. On the way back to the ancient city, see fascinating attractions like the 100-year-old Hijaz railway station. Visit iconic landmarks like the Umayyad Mosque and the Al-Hamidiyah Souq. Break for lunch and sample local cuisine. The afternoon includes more ancient houses, caravanserais, and exploring the souks. End the day with a sunset view from a rooftop vantage point.

Palmyra, Homs, and Krak Des Chevaliers | Experience the awe-inspiring wonders of Palmyra, a UNESCO World Heritage Site renowned for its magnificent ancient ruins that trace back to the Roman Empire. Immerse yourself in the city's captivating history, culture, and architectural splendor as you explore its well-preserved treasures. Continuing your journey, venture to Homs, a vibrant city steeped in heritage and boasting one of the world's oldest churches. As you venture further west to the enchanting Valley of Christians, you'll be treated to an overnight stay in a charming hotel nestled near the Crusaders' castle. Take in the mesmerizing surroundings and unwind in the midst of breathtaking landscapes. Delight in the opportunity to visit a local winery, where you can indulge in wine tasting and savor the flavors of Syria's renowned wine. This day promises to create lasting memories of Syria's rich historical legacy and its awe-inspiring natural beauty.

Krak Des Chevaliers, Hama, and Arrival in Aleppo | Begin the day by visiting the impressive Krak Des Chevaliers castle, one of the most significant and well-preserved medieval castles in the world. Then, head towards Hama, known for its norias, ancient waterwheels that have been used for centuries to irrigate the surrounding farmlands. Take a walk along the Orontes River and enjoy a traditional lunch at one of the local restaurants. After lunch, we will continue our drive to Aleppo, where we will spend the next two nights. Aleppo is a city steeped in history, with a vibrant culture and rich culinary traditions, and we will have plenty of time to explore its many sights and sounds. Once we arrive, we will check in to our hotel and have some free time to relax or explore the city on your own.

Full Day Tour of Aleppo | Visit the Citadel of Aleppo, stroll through the ancient city alleys, visit an 800-year-old soap factory, explore the souks of Aleppo, and visit the Aleppo Museum with its rare artifacts. You will also see the oldest functioning hotel in Syria and the 14th-century neighborhood of Jdaideh, which has impressive churches. The tour includes meeting some of the locals who have inspiring stories to share about their resilience and perseverance during the war. The day will end with a breathtaking panoramic view of the city and its magnificent citadel.

Apamea, Saladin Castle, and Latakia | After breakfast, we'll head to the ancient city of Apamea, located in the Orontes Valley, where you'll get to explore the Hellenistic ruins, including the impressive Great Colonnade. After that, we'll drive to Saladin Castle, one of the most well-preserved Crusader castles in Syria. Here you'll be able to walk along the castle walls, admire the views, and learn about the history of the region. Next, we'll continue our journey to Latakia, a charming coastal city on the Mediterranean Sea, check into our hotel for an overnight stay, where you can relax and enjoy the city's beautiful beaches and lively markets.

Ugarit and Arwad Island, Overnight in Mishtaya | We start the day by visiting the ancient city of Ugarit, which was once a major port and cultural center in the eastern Mediterranean. You'll explore the ruins of the city, including the palace and the royal archives where the oldest known alphabet was discovered. Afterwards, we'll drive to Tartus and take a boat to the picturesque Arwad Island, Syria's only island which has been inhabited since the Phoenician era. You'll have the opportunity to wander through the narrow alleys of the old town, visit the castle, and enjoy a seafood lunch by the sea. Next, we'll drive to Mishtaya and stay overnight there.

St. Moses Monastery, Maaloula, and Return to Damascus | The day begins with a visit to St. Moses Monastery, a historic site located on top of a mountain. The monastery is known for its unique architecture and its stunning location overlooking the surrounding mountains. To reach the monastery, we will need to hike around 300 steps, so it is recommended to wear comfortable shoes and bring water. Next, we will head to Maaloula, a small town that is home to one of the few remaining communities of Aramaic-speaking Christians in the world. We will visit the ancient monasteries and churches in the town, and learn about the rich history of the area. Finally, we will return to Damascus, where you can spend the rest of the day exploring the city at your own pace, shopping for souvenirs, or simply relaxing at your hotel.

Bosra | We drive for two hours through the fertile Horan plain and take in the views of the ruins and monuments. Explore the intact Roman amphitheater in Bosra and enjoy a delightful picnic in this historic city. The two-hour tour includes exploring temples, churches, and mosques made of black basalt stones and marveling at the Roman amphitheater. Return to Damascus for the last night of your unforgettable journey.

Departure from Damascus | Conclude the tour with a visit to the Sayyida Ruqiyah shrine, a lavishly decorated Shiite shrine with intricate glass mosaics and Kashani motifs, and to handicraft workshops where artisans craft swords, copper pieces, and mosaics. Afterward, a driver will be arranged to pick you up from the main square and transfer you to Beirut, Jordan or Damascus airport, based on your preference.
